title: American_Top_40_1978_March_11th
description:
"You're listening to American Top 40's weekly survey of the biggest hits from Fairbanks to Phoenix, from Hanover to Honolulu. I'm Casey Kasem."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

There is a new band called Van Halen. Their debut hit "You Really Got Me" is at number 38.

A listener wants to know when Billboard's National Disco Chart began and who held the very first number one spot in the survey. It's an act that has 2 top 10 hits in this countdown.

There is a band whose biggest obstacle to success was the name they chose.

The man who had the number one album on the very first album chart Billboard ever printed back in 1945 has a daughter in this countdown.

Casey answers the question, "Has there ever been a year since the British invasion when no English acts hit number 1 on the American chart?" It happened once, and Casey tells about it.

Casey tells about the all-male American group that has had more number one hits than any other.

There are songs in this countdown from a double album that, for the 3 weeks prior to March 11th of '78, was selling a mind-blowing 200,000 copies a day!
